author: he852100
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce
Fail
```powershell
set-NetFirewallRule ...

```

# Expected behavior
invoke-command -Session $session -filepath ./l.ps1 
```none
Set-NetFirewallRule: No MSFT_NetFirewallRule objects found with property 'DisplayName' equal to 'Block'.  Verify the value of the property and retry.

or other
```

# Actual behavior

```none
OperationStopped: Unable to load shared library 'libmi' or one of its dependencies. In order to help diagnose loading problems, consider setting the LD_DEBUG environment variable: liblibmi: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Pwsh.linux.Arm.7.1
```

comments.author: he852100
comments.body:
try catch invalid
```
try{
$null=Get-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName block
set-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName "Block" -Direction Inbound -RemoteAddress $ip.name -Protocol TCP -Action Block
}catch{
new-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName "Block" -Direction Inbound -RemoteAddress $ip.name -Protocol TCP -Action Block
}
```
out
```
Get-NetFirewallRule: No MSFT_NetFirewallRule objects found with property 'DisplayName' equal to 'block'.  Verify the value of the property and retry.
Set-NetFirewallRule: No MSFT_NetFirewallRule objects found with property 'DisplayName' equal to 'Block'.  Verify the value of the property and retry.
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: @he852100 not all errors are terminating by default. If you need to ensure they are caught by a try/catch you'll need to use `-ErrorAction Stop` on the cmdlets in the `try` block.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: /cc @anmenaga I see the NetSecurity module is core compatible but I am not sure that it is Unix compatible.

comments.author: anmenaga
comments.body:
@he852100 Please provide more info on your repro environment: what OS/device is it? and how did you deploy NetSecurity module on it?
Thank you.

comments.author: he852100
comments.body: Sorry, it's just an error message.  The problem with the arm client.

title: Windows powershell module remote Wrong message
